author: Diana
title: Mexican Chicken Marinade
ingredients: 1-2 pounds chicken (breasts, cutlets, thighs, or drumsticks)
instructions_list: To a Ziploc bag, add the chicken followed by the wet ingredients and the spices.
Seal the bag, and toss the chicken so that the chicken is well coated in the marinade.
Place in the fridge and allow to marinate for 2-24 hours.
Remove the chicken from the bag, and grill it or bake it until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F/74°C with an Instant read thermometer.
description: Make this fresh Mexican chicken marinade to season all of your favorite cuts of chicken. Made with lime, garlic, olive oil, oregano, and warm spices to give your chicken an amazing flavor!

reviews.author: M Ernst
reviews.reviewBody: Super Solid marinade!!  I did 5 pounds of breast meat and marinated around 6 hours and it was more than enoughtime. I use a ceramic grill with double racks and grilled top rack at around 400 so it was quick and super juicy. The marinade has great flavor and I sliced all the chicken thin for tacos. I will also tell you that for a left over salad basic LTO with ranch dressing the left overchicken was amazing. I made it even faster as I just hand some minced garlic in water that I substituted over fresh and it worked well. 15 people devoured it.

reviews.author: Marilyn
reviews.reviewBody: Delicious. Used Taco seasoning and some more garlic with smoked paprika! A real keeper and so simple!

reviews.author: Jeanette
reviews.reviewBody: Please don't be scared of the cinnamon. It added so much depth to the recipe. Absolutely loved it and so did the boyfriend. We're definitely adding this to our repertoire. Maybe next time I'll zest my lime to add the aromatic and extra citrus notes. This is definitely a keeper!

reviews.author: Grace D.
reviews.reviewBody: Excellent chicken marinade but leave out the optional cinnamon. I love cinnamon so I tried half of what was called for, only 1/8 tsp., But it was enough to give the marinade an off flavor that I did not care for. Without the cinnamon it would have been 5 stars. I do plan to make this again sans cinnamon!

reviews.author: Ken
reviews.reviewBody: I cut my chicken in small bite size pieces then marinate over night. I fry the meat in a cast iron skillet, delicious. I also use the marinade for my steak tacos too.

reviews.author: Carrie
reviews.reviewBody: I absolutely loved this.  I will make this again and again.  It was so flavorful. I used chicken breast left out the cinnamon and used fresh lemon instead of lime because that's what I had on hand.  While  I was pan frying the chicken I ended up finding a lime and squeezed some on and continued cooking.  This recipe was perfection.

reviews.author: Colleen Watson
reviews.reviewBody: Delish...will use again...and again!! I used pre-roasted whole chicken...chopped up the beast and larger pieces of the chicken and marinated it for 3 hours...was amazing in chicken tacos with pepper jack cheese, homemade pico de gallo, along with red salsa and sour cream! Created a perfect bite!!

reviews.author: Chanin
reviews.reviewBody: Delicious! This is EXACTLY the flavor I was looking for! Made crispy burritos with it last week and now it has been voted our go to chicken for Mexican night!

reviews.author: LaLa
reviews.reviewBody: This was good. But... I doubled the recipe and put it in the crockpot. After cooking for 2 hours I flipped the chicken and added 2 cups of chicken broth.  We all loved it.  (I also didnt have any limes so used lemon juice)

reviews.author: Patrick
reviews.reviewBody:
Loved this recipe, but I did spice it up a bit with 1/4tsp cayenne, omitted the cinnamon and used the sweeter Mexican Oregano.  Then, me being me (love spicy marinades) I doubled it, and cooked it in a cast iron skillet .

Took just minutes to make, left it in the fridge for like 20 hours and wow!  Delicious!

reviews.author: Amila
reviews.reviewBody: Made the recipe as is. The cinnamon gives it a secret taste that people wonder what it is.  And not to mention that this is sooo simple and soooo tasty!

reviews.author: Abbi
reviews.reviewBody: I made this without the cumin because my bf doesn’t like it, and it was SO GOOD. Used this chicken to mix with rice and cheese inside a burrito. So freaking good

reviews.author: Susan
reviews.reviewBody: Wonderful Chicken.  I used skinless boneless thighs.  Barbecued them and this recipe is so easy and definitely a keeper.
